  n⁴ + 4 = n⁴ + 4n² + 4 − 4n²

Step 2. Decompose into partial fractions.
We claim that
  n/(n⁴ + 4) = (1/4)[1/(n² − 2n + 2) − 1/(n² + 2n + 2)].
To check, combine the right-hand side:
  (1/4)[1/(n² − 2n + 2) − 1/(n² + 2n + 2)]
  = (1/4)[(n² + 2n + 2) − (n² − 2n + 2)] / [(n² − 2n + 2)(n² + 2n + 2)]
  = (1/4)(4n) / (n⁴ + 4)
  = n/(n⁴ + 4),
so the decomposition is indeed valid.
